name: Monterey Submarine Canyon (CA)
info: 8–10 humpbacks feeding in the afternoon; breaches and tail throws; Risso’s dolphins present.

name: Newport Offshore (CA)
info: 3 humpbacks documented on trips; thousands of common dolphins also observed.

name: East Sound — Orcas Island (WA)
info: T100 family confirmed; small family group led by ~46-yr matriarch; observed in East Sound then continuing travel.

name: San Juan Islands (WA)
info: ‘Orca-filled day’ with multiple encounters; pod of ~4 transients cruising the islands.

name: Fauntleroy / Brace Point — Puget Sound (WA)
info: Juvenile humpback ~500 yds off Fauntleroy ferry; fluke shows; mid-day sighting.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Transient orcas traveling the Strait; notes on long-range daily movements and marine-mammal prey.

name: Strait of Georgia — Nanaimo (BC)
info: Seasonal humpbacks working tide lines; seen alongside Bigg’s orcas the same period.

name: Resurrection Bay — Seward (AK)
info: Multiple orca pods reported in early August; operators noted strong, frequent sightings continuing.

name: Aialik Bay — Kenai Fjords (AK)
info: Recent day tour reported humpbacks along fjords and shelf edges (late-season feeding).

name: Kenai Fjords / Gulf side (AK)
info: Tour reports included orca encounters alongside humpbacks during long day trips.

name: Monterey Bay — Mid-Canyon (CA)
info: 12–15 humpbacks feeding; pec-slaps and surface activity through late morning.

name: Haro Strait — US/Canada Line (WA)
info: Single humpback spotted while crossing back into U.S. waters after orca encounters.
